metadata.Name: JaLeCoN
metadata.Description: First Japanese Lexical Complexity Prediction dataset with separate scores for Chinese/Korean and other L1 backgrounds.
Provider: Nara Institute of Science and Technology
metadata.Paper Title: Japanese Lexical Complexity for Non-Native Readers: A New Dataset
Affiliations: Nara Institute of Science and Technology
metadata.Abstract: Lexical complexity prediction (LCP) is the task of predicting the complexity of words in a text on a continuous scale. It plays a vital role in simplifying or annotating complex words to assist readers. To study lexical complexity in Japanese, we construct the first Japanese LCP dataset. Our dataset provides separate complexity scores for Chinese/Korean annotators and others to address the readers' L1-specific needs. In the baseline experiment, we demonstrate the effectiveness of a BERT-based system for Japanese LCP.
